data.text:
dbo:abstract

S. V. Ranga Rao (born Samarla Venkata Ranga Rao; 3 July 1918 – 18 July 1974), popularly known as SVR, was an Indian film actor, producer, and director known for his works majorly in Telugu and Tamil films. He is regarded as one of the finest actors in the history of Indian cinema. He is known by the epithet "Viswa Nata Chakravarthi" (transl. "Universal Emperor of Acting"). He was the earliest known character actor to have enjoyed a star status in South Indian cinema. In a career spanning nearly three decades, Ranga Rao garnered various national and international honours. Ranga Rao was a method actor known for his natural acting style, portraying complex — social, biographical, and mythological — characters such as 'Nepala Manthrikudu', a tantric in Pathala Bhairavi (1951), Yama in Sati Savitri (1957), Ghatothkacha in Maya Bazaar (1957), Mayasura in Bhookailas (1958), Bhoja in Mahakavi Kalidasu (1960). In 1964, he received the Best Actor Award for his portrayal of Kichaka in Nartanasala (1963) at the third Afro-Asian Film Festival held in Jakarta, becoming the only Indian actor to have ever garnered the honour. He then essayed Duryodhana in the blockbuster Pandava Vanavasam (1965), Hiranyakasipu in Bhakta Prahlada (1967), and Ravana in Sampoorna Ramayanam (1971) to name a few. He made his foray as a character actor in films such as Mana Desam (1949), Palletoori Pilla (1950), Devadasu (1953), Bangaru Papa (1954), Raju Peda (1954), Thodi Kodallu (1957), Chenchu Lakshmi (1958), Pelli Naati Pramanalu (1958), Nammina Bantu (1959), Gundamma Katha (1962), Sarada (1962), Aatma Bandhuvu (1962), Annai (1962), Karpagam (1963), Naanum Oru Penn (1963), Bobbili Yuddham (1964), Bandhavyalu (1968), Prema Nagar (1971), Dasara Bullodu (1971), Pandanti Kapuram (1972), Vasantha Maligai (1972), Thatha-Manavadu (1973), and Andaru Dongale (1974). Government of Andhra Pradesh instituted an award in his memory, presented every year to the best character acting performance, known as the S. V. Ranga Rao Award for Best Character Actor. (en)

Samarla Venkata Ranga Rao (3 Juli 1918 – 18 Juli 1974) yang lebih dikenal sebagai S.V.R. adalah seorang aktor, sutradara dan produser film India yang dikenal karena karya-karyanya dalam sinema Telugu dan Tamil. Lebih dikenal sebagai salah satu India terhandal, Rao lebih dikenal sebagai "Viswa Nata Chakravarthi." Ia dikenal karena akting alaminya dan karena memerankan peran-peran karakter mitologi Hindu seperti Rahwana, Gatotkaca, Duryudana, Kamsa dan Kicaka dari Mitologi India. Pada 1963, Ia meraih Penghargaan Aktor Terbaik karena ia memerankan Kicaka dalam Nartanasala di yang diadakan di Jakarta. Ia meraih Penghargaan Rashtrapati sebanyak lima kali karena berakting dalam sinema Telugu dan Tamil. (in)
